meanings.definition: Examine (an egg) by holding it up to a bright light source to check for freshness or the presence of a developing embryo.
meanings.sent1: She was candling the eggs to see if any were spoiled.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was candling the eggs to make sure they were safe to eat.
meanings.sent3: The kids found candling the eggs oddly fascinating.
meanings.sent4: Candling the eggs revealed secrets hidden within.
meanings.sent5: The process of candling made the eggs' contents clear as day.

meanings.definition: Illuminate (something) with a candle or other light source.
meanings.sent1: He was candling the room with a flashlight during the blackout.
meanings.sent2: The campers were candling the path with lanterns.
meanings.sent3: Candling the garden with fairy lights created a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The city was candling the night sky with fireworks.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse was candling the stormy sea, guiding ships to safety.
